subject: Re: [junit] accessing variables of private methods?
msgSnippet: ... You can t. Local variables are inaccessible, no matter how hard you try. Instead, observe the side effects of those methods and make assertions on those
messageBody:
Ajay kumar wrote:

> Dear Friends,
>
> I have a class which has got some private methods with a return type of
> void. I am using a class(PivilegedAccessor referred in junit faqs) to
> invoke these private methods. Can anyone tell me how to access the
> variables inside this private method. These variables are local to thier
> methods.

You can't. Local variables are inaccessible, no matter how hard you try.
Instead, observe the side effects of those methods and make assertions
on those side effects.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
